oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Suturing the Nictitating Membrane for Treatment of Pinkeye in the Bovine
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Brown, Cyril
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Keratoconjunctivitis
pinkeye
vaccine
facefly
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Keratoconjunctivitis, commonly called pinkeye, has been a recognized condition in cattle for many years. Over the years, treatment methods have varied. Some were successful, others failed. The old-timers talked about pinkeye vaccine which has only become a reality recently; and we wonder about their efficiency. The spread of eye pathology from cow to cow has no doubt been a bigger problem with the advent of the facefly.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1977; 153-154
